result.execSummary:
The defendant Blake D Fenninger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IF REVOKED 1 day sentence credit granted

miscConds.notes:
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended 

Absolute sobriety, random UA's

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia

All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy

Inform agent of all prescriptions

Anger management counseling to be determined by agent

No new law violations

Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid by 12/06/22 as a condition of probation

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

timeConds.notes: Complete 20 hours of community service within the first 10 months of probation at agents direction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Blake D Fenninger

Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel/ordered psychological evaluation and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty. Paul Bucher.

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on October 10, 2022 - APPROVED.** 
Clerk sent to BC on 10-11-22
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

12:05 PM Defendant Blake D Fenninger in court.  Attorney Paul E Bucher in court for Blake D Fenninger.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for jury status hearing.
Parties have reached an agreement.  
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
Withheld sentence.  Credit for 1 day if revoked.

Term of Probation: 12 Months
Conditions of Probation:
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Absolute Sobriety; 
-	Random U.A.'s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy
-	Inform agent of all prescriptions;
-	Anger management counseling to be determined by Agent.  
-	Complete 20 hours of community service within the first 10 months of probation;
-	No new law violations;

RESTITUTION: $ 0 (zero)

COSTS:  $ 243.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid by 12/6/22. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:27 AM Defendant Blake D Fenninger in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and victim key and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant was given a petition for appointment of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
